definition: to have a competition/to measure with one's hand or arm/to make a gesture of measuring
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
to test/to try/experiment/examination/test

sentences.english: The result of the competition exceeded our expectation.
sentences.chinese: 比試的結果超過了我們的預期值。

sentences.english: Eyes a bright, incredibly have force monk is having a competition?

sentences.english: He challenged me to a debate.

sentences.english: Scholes even in high spirits and a lot of children Bishi.

sentences.english: We could see him as actually vying with scripture.

sentences.english: Challenge other customers to duels with tubes of gift wrap.

sentences.english: Attempt is more effective than empty words.
sentences.chinese: 虛爭空言，不比試之易效。

sentences.english: When competition, four people found that, zhao big incredibly also promised two request.
sentences.chinese: 比試時，四人發現，趙大居然同時答應了兩方的要求。
